intro: Sebastiania bilocularis, commonly known as the two-chambered sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and elliptical, waxy leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
